website_summaries.verdict: Cheap but versatile, this rack extends up to 16 inches.
pros: Weather-resistant coating and rack that extends from 2 to 12 inches
Affordable choice for outdoor or indoor wood storage
cons: Some consumers reported missing pieces and undrilled holes

customer_reviews.title: NEW VERSION COMES IN 3 PIECES THAT NEED TO BE SCREWED TOGETHER.
customer_reviews.text: I previously purchased two sets of this Landmann rack, have been using them for probably 6-7 years, and they have held up well including an occasional bump as I have backed into them with my pickup. Each end on previous versions were however one solid piece of tubing. In the new version I have received, each end comes in three pieces -- the top upside down U and then the two legs, each making up half the total height, that you have to put together with screws. This is not called out in Amazon's description of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 2 sets because we maintain a large wood pile here in Minnesota. They are perfect, very tidy and easy to cover. The pictures speak for themselves. These came from Wayfair, from whom we have purchased other products for our home. Good company. It's nice they have an association with Amazon. It benefits everyone. We returned another product we had purchased at a Home Improvement store that was not as good.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment! Dont do it.
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked to find out that these came in 2 pieces. I have 3 sets of a similar product that is 1 piece of harden steel. The bottom welds are complete junk. I set these up on (2) 2x4x8' pressure treated. before my stack of wood was 1/2 way to the top of the rack the welds at the bottom started to give way. I had to add support to both sides of the rack in order to keep from losing my stack. once I burn thru the wood on this rack I'm sure they will be worth nothing more than scrap metal. Don't waste your money on this. One of the worst products I ever bought thru amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Ploe

customer_reviews.title: Great great firewood rack
customer_reviews.text: Gosh I love this product. This is my 8th purchase I believe and actually this one has changed slightly but it is a fabulous improvement. The metal parts are now in two pieces with the proper nuts and bolts added. This makes it much easier to store when you are done (if you don’t want to leave it out). Some of the older ones are still being used without any problem because they are very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Mariel1951

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: I choose this for a few reasons, the first being that the design allows you to easily break it down into two fairly flat pieces for storage once the wood is gone, and second, because of the reviews I read regarding the quality. I am impressed with the guage of steel for the posts compared to others I saw. We put a good amount of wood on a 10' span of 2x4's and it is working great. I would recommend the sturdy canvas cover to keep the wood dry and protected, plus it's just nicer to look at if it's in a high visible area.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Hostess

customer_reviews.title: Big, neat stacks of firewood
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 4 units based on the reviews on Amazon. I'll probably end up buying at least 4 more before the end of the year. These racks fit the pressure treated 2x4x12 boards perfectly. I was able to assemble the units quickly and without assistance. I have seen no evidence of strength issues despite overstacking split (wet heavy) oak. This is one of those products that I'd give 6 stars. Good price, delivered as advertised, and most importantly working better than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Mostly a good product
customer_reviews.text: The rack itself is pretty sturdy and we were able to put almost a face cord in it. So the rack is good. But the cover is terrible and started to tear in the first week, even though we were very careful with it. The cold made it worse when we had to access it, and no matter how careful we were, it continued to tear. Even when left alone, the cold and windy weather caused stress on the plastic and it was pretty much worthless in no time at all. Very disappointed with the cover, especially for what we paid for it. The cover should have been better quality.
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: Best rack I have
customer_reviews.text: I have three different versions of this kind of thing (and a couple of homemade jobbies) all around the same price. This one is the toughest and the most useful. I have mine on 12' 2x4s and it's sturdy enough that I can drag it around the yard (empty) without worrying about damaging it. The flat of the 2x4s on the bottom means that it doesn't sink into my soft soil even when completely loaded. I have it five feet tall with split maple right now and it's solid as a rock, no fear of it shifting or sinking.
customer_reviews.author: John L. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Perfect wood holder
customer_reviews.text: (Researched various styles of wood holders for about a week before purchasing this). Purchased two-one for porch and one for indoor. Love it! Very easy to assemble and sturdy. Love that you can make the width of your choice. Now we will have a more significant amount of wood out of the weather and ready for use. Wish I had found these years ago. First pic does not show the full length. It is 8ft long. Second pic is 4ft long. (The rack is not against the walls-it is free standing) Again, love this rack and it was definitely worth the $$$.
customer_reviews.author: saundra marshall

customer_reviews.title: Made in China
customer_reviews.text: Landmann USA advertises this rack as such leading one to believe they’re purchasing a USA made product. It is a cheap CHINESE made rack labeled “Made in China”. How disappointing. I would have never purchased this had I known. It is flimsy and the assembly holes don’t line up properly. I do not understand the high ratings from others.
customer_reviews.author: lrchops

customer_reviews.title: Nice Rack
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these originally about 15 years ago. Needed some more. They're doing the job. 2x4s slid right in and secured through predrilled holes. Only difference from originals is now you have to screw top and bottom sections together. Originals were one solid piece. Seem secure and solid but we'll see if these last longer than 15 years. Originals are fine just needed more.
customer_reviews.author: WC

customer_reviews.title: Love the adjustability.
customer_reviews.text: Like all Landmann products, great quality. But the coolest thing about these “bookends” is the adjustability. Want to store more or less wood? Just use a longer or shorter 2’ X 4’! You can use a 2’ X 6’ (or wider) to raise the wood higher off the ground too. We moved since we bought this. Piece of cake. Disassembled into to flat pieces. Try that with a regular wood rack.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Good adjustable firewood rack
customer_reviews.text: I am very please so far with this fire wood rack! I was able to put this together in less than 10 mins - note you will need your own screws and also the 2x4” boards. We had 2 pieces of 8’ wood so that ended up being our length (this rack allows you to adjust or make a rack to the size you want). We just put over a cord of wood in the rack and so far it’s holding up great! Good buy and while you have to get wood and screws, it’s nice to be able to make it the length tho want.
customer_reviews.author: NorthPole19

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: Don't expect to be able to stack wood higher than the 4 foot height of the bars. If you do, it can't stand the weight of the wood and begins to bend at the welds where the bars meet the clamp that goes around the wood. If you want to be able to go above the bars, buy the all metal version. I've had no problems with that!
customer_reviews.author: hoopguy

customer_reviews.title: Make it any size you need/want
customer_reviews.text: Love this wood rack. Had a space between a window and the edge of the porch to put a wood rack. Everything I looked at was either too long so the wood covered the window, or narrow and tall. This woodrack was adjustable. I could make it any length. You just need 2 x 4s cut to the length you need. Easy to assemble and very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Susan V

customer_reviews.title: Went together super easy.
customer_reviews.text: Not possible to screw it up. Stacks great. It's narrower than I thought but that turned out to be fine for the wood that I have. I decided (silly me) to have the standard 2x4s cut down to 6' from 8'. Mistake. Stay with 8'. I'm not sure I have a cord but I'm pretty sure that if I ever buy a full cord, it won't fit in the rack that I have ended up with using 6' 2x4s.
customer_reviews.author: The Lin Family

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality and adjustable for any space!
customer_reviews.text: I was able to custom cut the 2x4'a to fit perfectly in our laundry room and now we can keep an entire weeks worth of wood indoors. We heat our home with a woodstove ...but don't have much room near the stove or hearth to keep a large supply of wood. No one likes to go out to the wood pile and haul wood every day ...plus even with the best cover once winter hits the wood gets damp ...Super simple...sturdy..great concept.
customer_reviews.author: kate richards

customer_reviews.title: Sheet Goods Rack!
customer_reviews.text: I RARELY write reviews, so hopefully this is an indication as to how much I like this guy. I have been looking high and low for a sheet goods rack (holding plywood, boards, etc). I simply couldn't find anything that wasn't a couple hundred bucks, and I was just about to weld one when I found this guy instead. Using a couple short 1.5ft boards, it makes for a nice and simple rack that fits inside my garage. I simply put it up against a wall, and can stack several boards upright, and can keep them from bending and warping.
customer_reviews.author: J. Siefer

customer_reviews.title: Parts are poorly manufactured
customer_reviews.text: Rack just arrived. I tried to assemble and you can see from the photos that the rack will never work. The lower frame pieces would be aligned off by 20 degrees!! Also, holes are misaligned so poorly you could never assemble them. I may update my review based on how the manufacturer responds.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Dohm

customer_reviews.title: Good product, good price
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son who just moved into his first house. He put a wood burning stove in the basement but needed a place to store wood. This fit the bill. Once full, I got him another one just like it. Now he had a splitter and can get free wood, split, and store, greatly reducing his electric bill. He set it up on cinder blocks to keep up off the ground. Good idea.
customer_reviews.author: Sister Carol

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for intended use.
customer_reviews.text: The negative reviews for this item are RIDICULOUS! It is OBVIOUS that you have to supply your own 2 X 4 which I paid $2.40 for at the Depot. Do you all seriously think the company is going to send a 2 X 4 to you? This item is perfect for storage of firewood. My only complaint would be its a bit expensive and sadly made in China.
customer_reviews.author: C. McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Should Have Bought TWO
customer_reviews.text: Had a wood pile to split, so bought this. Build with two, 10 foot pressure treated 2X4s was easy. My problem, wood pile after splitting, was larger than I thought. Had to put together a self-made holder with rebar and bent conduit. Wood was still wet, so this pile will have to sit for at least 9 months.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry, Las Vegas

customer_reviews.title: Good product with poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several of these over the years and they are pretty good. I was assembling this latest one and found that the holes for the nuts and bolts were very misaligned. I had to redrill four of the holes to be able to assemble. Quality control needs to be improved.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: So simple to put together. I went to hardware ...
customer_reviews.text: So simple to put together. I went to hardware store and asked for two lengths of wood in the size I wanted. I drilled screws in so it didn't shift and it made the garage so much neater.
customer_reviews.author: Crowzhome

customer_reviews.title: Good rack, but with minor assembly issue
customer_reviews.text: Besides separately acquiring and attaching 2x4s, some minor assembly is required. This entails attaching four extension tubes to the ends of the two upper curved parts of the rack ends. A couple of provided nuts and bolts through predrilled holes does the job. My only complaint is that the predrilled holes for one of the extensions did not line up and I had to drill new holes myself. Not a big deal but is something the maker should get right! Once assembled you'll have a pretty good wood rack.
customer_reviews.author: Londonman9

customer_reviews.title: Nice firewood holder
customer_reviews.text: Just so you are aware this is just the side pieces. You still have to buy the 2x4 to mount the end pieces to. I bought 1 pressure treated 2x4x8 and had them cut it in half to make a 4 foot long holder. Assembly was easy. Took a hammer to tap the 2x4 ends into the holder. Works for what I needed it.
customer_reviews.author: Candi H. Calvac-Perez

customer_reviews.title: Careful when you load it
customer_reviews.text: This rack was easy to put together. If you don't have it on a flat level surface it's pretty unstable with wood stacked on it. I purchased a very similar item several years ago that the metal is about twice as thick. This rack bent slightly out once wood was stacked on it. I ended up strapping a cargo strap around it to keep it from bending. With the cargo strap I loaded it pretty good and it seems to be holding up well though.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and holds a lot of logs. My husband said it was easy to put together. Nice compact size. We had another one that was crushed by a falling tree. It had been out in the elements for a year and showed no signs of corrosion.
customer_reviews.author: J. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Excelent
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Well made. We were pleased so we bought a second one. Both racks are holding up well, though this is our first winter with them I do t expect any issues as they are exactly what we were looking for. Love that we could customize them to the size we need. We heat our entire home by a wood stove, so these are restocked weekly and are holding up to the task.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Useful!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put on the side porch, so that we could bring wood from the wood shed to the house and have some stored wood on the porch. We put pressure treated 2x4s about 6 feet long in the base and it is perfect. We've piled a lot of heavy red oak and hickory wood in it and it's held the weight easily. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and handsome
customer_reviews.text: I was initially concerned about the sturdiness of this product, but it is very stable, even when we load it heavily. (I used 4' 2 x 4's and put some cross braces on the bottom) I also think it's quite attractive compared to some. It looks really nice, especially fully loaded. (0: Nice product!
customer_reviews.author: Renee Walter

customer_reviews.title: No sagging and great construction
customer_reviews.text: Assembly is a breeze and I've used it to hold about half a cord of wood for a little over a year and a half now. I haven't had any issues with it sagging inward or outwards, no rust and I keep it outside through the year (I do have a cover on mine though).
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy and Durable
customer_reviews.text: I use this rack to stack firewood on my screened porch. I love that I can take it apart and store it when I'm finished with it. It seems very sturdy and is exactly what I was expecting. I have it full of wood (I actually stacked it higher than the rack sides) and it doesn't show any sign of stress or strain. I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: It holds wood!
customer_reviews.text: These do the trick. I didn’t realize the sides came in 2 parts and needed to be bolted together. It’s not a huge deal but overall a little weaker than I’d hoped. Overall it works well. I’m using it inside the house with 24” 2x4’s as an inside wood rack. Much more capacity than most indoor racks and very inexpensive
customer_reviews.author: HankSteel

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Great amount of bang for the buck on this rack. Easy to assemble have to buy your own wood screws or nails. Buy two 8ft. 2x4’s and your good. I bought a 8ft firewood rack cover at Home Depot because it was cheapest deal that I could find but this rack is the way to go!
customer_reviews.author: aaron m fiegl

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and easier price
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought this setup. Not only was the price super nice, I loved how I could adjust the amount of wood I could hold just by how long or short I made the 2x4s. Once you secure the 2x4s in the slots, this is a solid and study setup. Would definitely recommend and buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn B.

customer_reviews.title: Love that it can be adjusted so you can make ...
customer_reviews.text: Love that it can be adjusted so you can make whatever size you want. I would actually recommend buying 3 bars. Put the first two 3.5 feet apart and stack all your logs; put the 3rd bar 6" apart from the 2nd bar. In the 6" space place your kindling wood. The total length would be 4 feet and you can buy a 4 foot cover. I might do this next winter.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: great idea
customer_reviews.text: We are thrilled with it. My husband is a handyman so getting this together was a simple project for him. We liked the fact that it can be a sized to one's needs and also easy to take apart if you don't want it up year round.
customer_reviews.author: Montana Mom

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & well made.
customer_reviews.text: Well made and easy to assemble. In addition to the included parts you will need a couple of untreated 2X4s and 8 wood or sheet rock screws 1” to 1-1/4” long. Took about 15 minutes to build. Tools are a Phillips head screwdriver and a 10mm wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great Firewood rack!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't able to do this review prior as I had not set it up yet. Well, I did yesterday and it is great. I only made it about 3 feet wide for my needs and the cover I found fits great! It is strong and easily went together. The shipping was fast and packaged well. Thank you Landmann USA and Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Florida Girl

customer_reviews.title: It is a good rack for one year maybe.
customer_reviews.text: I have an older version of the same rack. It is 15 years older. The rack purchased is a POC. The weld is already weakening because I loaded wood on the rack. It is bending on both ends and looks like a W rather than a U. Caveat Emptor. Somebody some money, it wasn't me.
customer_reviews.author: Carson E. Graves

customer_reviews.title: Solid stands.
customer_reviews.text: This product is pretty straight forward, and easy to install. I wouldn't recommend use for a large amount of wood. I use it to hold a small amount in my garage for a quick resupply.
customer_reviews.author: anessa santiago

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Note: doesn’t fit pressure treated 2x4, had to chisel about 1/4” off to get it to slide in. Otherwise has worked out well. Not super sturdy but has held up so far.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew, MA

customer_reviews.title: It fit my needs!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy I got this. I can keep the wood just outside my door where it is dry and organized. It can be adjusted to basically any width you want to accommodate more or less wood. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Sanjuana leal

customer_reviews.title: did the job !
customer_reviews.text: would have been better if each side was one piece instead of two and a bit pricey for what you get but with 2x4 cut to your preferred size they'll do the job
customer_reviews.author: unknown

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!!! Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for - love that you can basically build this to whatever size you need. Item was exactly as described and could not have been easier to put together. This is a definite must buy for anyone needing to stack a serious amount of firewood.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, best buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: This product is inexpensive. You can use a couple of those 2 x 4s sitting in your garage, cut them to the length you like, and presto! you have your firewood rack. I keep mine in the house near the woodstove so all my cut firewood is right there, dry, neatly stacked, ready to use.
customer_reviews.author: rockymtnbluebird

customer_reviews.title: Love this for our inside rack beside our fireplace which ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this for our inside rack beside our fireplace which needed a custom fit. We did not even use treated wood. Also have one for outside (used with treated wood), but we placed it on cinder blocks for better air circulation and and to better support the center section. It hasn't gone through a season of outside weather yet so don't know how the finish will hold up. However, I can always respray the black if need be. Either way it's worth the purchase price.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Firewood Rack was easy to assemble, and has proven very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Simplistic assembly. I cut two 2x4" at five feet and then nailed the uprights to them. I have used it for the past couple of months and have loaded it chocked full with wood about a dozen times. Very sturdy construction.
customer_reviews.author: H G Chamberlain III

customer_reviews.title: Great back yard Firewood Rack
customer_reviews.text: Great back yard Firewood Rack, I wouldn't stack the wood over it's size because I don't think it will take the weight but it's works great for fire pit logs.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Lemon

customer_reviews.title: Bottom Piece
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised it didn't come with the bottom piece. Purchased (2) 4' 2x4s for the bottom and one won't go in the slot. I will need to sand down the wood so it will fit.
customer_reviews.author: catboose

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Wood Stand
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this before at Home Depot, but they don't carry on stock anymore. I just received my order from Amazon via Phoenix AZ and love it. My son's in-laws had no place to store they small stack of firewood so I got this as a house warming gift for their garage, 5 feet long. Thanks guys.
customer_reviews.author: A.C.E.

customer_reviews.title: Less Height = Less Stacking Space
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. This rack is 7" shorter than our Pleasant Hearth rack (48") for the same price. My mistake. If you're planning to buy this, consider the taller one. I wish I had made sure I was buying the right one.
customer_reviews.author: lorietene

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, but sturdy and practical!
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome because you can make it as long or short as you want. I bought 2 2x12 2x4's and made it 11 ft long. I used the pieces I cut off to make supposts for the middle. It's only 14.5 inches wide so its ideal for shorter logs. I would recommend this product to anyone looking to store firewood indoors (mine is sitting in the garage, see pictures). Couldn't be happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: WAG

customer_reviews.title: So easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Love that this product can be adjusted to the size you need simply by buying the size of 2x length you need. Gave it to my son as a Christmas gift and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Horse handler

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Used some 10ft 2x4 pieces. Didn't hold an entire cord of wood, but could use longer pieces to hold more. Keeps wood dry and off the ground. Would like the rails to be taller but overall a good cheap solution for storing wood. Assembly is fairly easy. Stabilized with some shorter pieces connected to the two long pieces for a sturdy rack.
customer_reviews.author: RuggedOrange

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and holds a LOT of firewood.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. This was so easy to install and it holds a LOT of wood. I bought 2 and will get 4 more for the firewood racks in my basement. Strong. Fits 2x4's well.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Tommm

customer_reviews.title: Holds a ton of wood!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit nervous when I first looked at this and thought about 16 feet, but I decided to go for it along our fence line. did great! Stacks really well and holds in place great! I would buy again! Update: Make sure that you check your lumber. On my second set one of the 2 base boards had a bit of a twist in it. I figured the weight of the logs would even things out. Well it did the opposite and amplified the twist making it unsteady. After leveling didn't work I had to replace the board. The rack ends are still holding up great after 3 seasons.
customer_reviews.author: KateNBrad

customer_reviews.title: Quality product, reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I had previously purchased racks from Lowe’s and paid the same amount. After trying this product, I purchased 3 more of them. The quality and durability is far superior to Lowe’s brand.
customer_reviews.author: Brad M

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 1 season
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, this product only lasted 1 year before the weld connecting an arm to the base failed. This was not a good investment for me.
customer_reviews.author: bswarmer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Solidly built and inexpensive solution to stacking firewood either inside or outside. All you need are a couple of 2 by 4s and eight wood screws in addition to these tubes. Easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set of racks. The first two worked so well that I ordered a second pair. Up to this point I have been building wood storage racks and while they are slightly cheaper they take time and are not as strong. All you need is these racks plus 2x4"s and in 10 minutes you have a rack ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like these.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried different methods to keep my firewood stacked and this product is my favorite to date. I've bought two sets and like them because I can adjust the length of the rack and they hold the wood just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Watch how you assemble the parts together
customer_reviews.text: Add 2- 2 x 4’s a few cross supports and you have a solid frame, watch when assembling the parts together the “legs” have an inside and out side, make sure the holes face out, it will allow you to screw into the 2x4 much easier
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: It’s great because you can size it to your specifications exactly. Sturdy. I think it will last a long time. I did add a cross beam for strength and of course, used pressure treated 2x4s.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: This our third one. We have two on the back porch and one in a shop. They works great and my husband stacks a lot on it.
customer_reviews.author: Carbin

customer_reviews.title: Look Elsewhere!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible workmanship! The top mount part of the handle was not fully drilled through so I can’t properly secure unless I send it back for a new 1 or i finish drilling the holes myself!!! Will never buy this brand or recommend This is why YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Gillette

customer_reviews.title: Pretty basic but perfect for what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't need anything grand or heavy duty. This proved to be perfect. easy to set up and holds my wood perfectly. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but hopefully it holds up for many years
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, seems a little thin but I guess wood doesn't exactly transfer the energy all outward. It would have been nice if they were 1 piece with no assembly as that might a weak link, but maybe not. Easy to assemble and it does look nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Handshy

customer_reviews.title: It’s worth the money
customer_reviews.text: You need 2x4s to run through this rack. I didn’t notice that. But this rack seems to be well constructed and solid. I elivated it with some 4x6 so the steel wouldn’t be sitting in water if it rains. Got a cover and it’s a nice addition to my oasis.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnie Slayton

customer_reviews.title: One Size Fits All
customer_reviews.text: I liked that I could make it the exact size that I needed. We store wood indoors with it and needed something that fit between the window and fireplace. We wanted something simple but nice looking. My husband painted the bottom boards black and it looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce A. Flatt

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed for a firewood rack
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble. I bought pressure treated 8ft 2X4s and screwed together with included hardware. Nice and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: juve

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Have had for a year now and it is holding up well. Simple design gets the job done! I plan on buying another one so I can have more wood delivered at once.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Cost effective wood pile organizer.
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly, would be nice if it came with the screws to secure it to the wood. Rack is 4 pieces that slide together and secure with provided hardware, no tools included.
customer_reviews.author: Jennine Mustard

customer_reviews.title: does what I needed. Bought the adjustable one so ...
customer_reviews.text: does what I needed. Bought the adjustable one so I could cut the 2x4 cross pieces to the width we needed to fit the location I was putting this in. I did add some smaller cross pieces at each end and at the middle to connect the 2 long 2x4s to prevent it from spreading out.
customer_reviews.author: Peter L

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: Great value. High quality construction and finish. Length can be adjusted to fit most areas. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Went together super easy. Didn’t think it would hold wood because I couldn’t get it super tight but it works fine for about 100 pieces of wood.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I like about this is the shipping, it was quick. Here’s the bad part, They took the cheap way out of it. First you have to get the 2 x 4 which is five bucks then it doesn’t come with screws or nails to attach the metal pieces to the 2 x 4 and it doesn’t tell you a size or anything. Basically you’re just paying for the metal bars. I would highly recommend saving your money.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Smith

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for us
customer_reviews.text: Easyset up. Great price compared to other brands. Also like that when its empty & we dontneed it set up during winter wecan just take out the 2x4s & store it in the shed.
customer_reviews.author: Mom life!

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality control. When we assembled the bottom legs with the top pieces, the holes were clearly not drilled in the correct location so the entire thing is crooked. It still works and seems sturdy, but c’mon...
customer_reviews.author: John Peters

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive but needs some quality control
customer_reviews.text: Product would have been easier to assemble had the employee setting the piece into the jig to get the holes drilled was wearing glasses. Bolted the end pieces together but it would not allow the boards to run parallel to each other. Had to remove the bolts and ream out the holes to allow the bottom boards to run parallel.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Bartling

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I recommend bracing between the wood planks. For added stability for the weight of the firewood on the 2x4. I used 2x4x8
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Tate

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Simple and decent build quality. The unit should come with screws to connect frame to 2x4 boards, it does not.
customer_reviews.author: T4i Shooter

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble...perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to assemble and is sturdy. For the price it's ideal and can be moved to other locations if desired.
customer_reviews.author: gnikking

customer_reviews.title: Awesome firewood rack.
customer_reviews.text: What a great idea to use pressure treated 2x4s for a firewood support base... and to determine the overall length of the steel rack. Very strong, and maximizes the available space.
customer_reviews.author: L. South

customer_reviews.title: Great for stacking wood neatly!
customer_reviews.text: We love this. Highly recommend. We have wood stacked to the full extension; I think six feet! Works great, saves space, we have wood stacked inside garage!
customer_reviews.author: Savannah D.

customer_reviews.title: works great, very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Keeps firewood organized nicely. I did set this on a few blocks to keep it off the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Bobkat

customer_reviews.title: It works well
customer_reviews.text: I put it on my porch and made it 70” wide, it functions exactly like it should. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Taras Kolosiej

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Make any length needed was the main reason to purchase. Wanted it to fit neatly into an opening beside garage. Recently purchased so I can't speak on longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my kindling
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and seems to work great. I bought this in conjunction with another brand’s wood rack. I’m happy with the other rack but it cost me $180 compared with this one for $24. I use it with two 4’ 2X4s. It holds all the kindling I need for my fire pit.
customer_reviews.author: Mainers

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 1/2 cord of wood
customer_reviews.text: I used 4 2x4 8' pressure treated. I overlapped them about 12 inches and used 3" galvanized screws. I also cut 3 cross braces from another 2x4. 2 on the ends and one in the middle. Each 'end' comes in two pieces with nuts and bolts to put them together. Worked fine. The only thing that was missing is screws to attach the metal braces to the wood. I used galvanized nails that I already had. Building the rack like this was the perfect size for 1/2 cord of cut wood.
customer_reviews.author: JRWall

customer_reviews.title: Nice piece
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice piece but it would be much more sturdy if the tubing for each end were one piece instead of three.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great firewood holder for outside
customer_reviews.text: Tough for outdoor firewood. Just what we needed. Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: A. Buzzell

customer_reviews.title: Great log holder
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fo my needs. Simple to put together. Seems sturdy. I used 2 12' -2"×4" boards. Elevated by using bricks to protect the wood from the elements. Ver pleased with my purchase. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene M

customer_reviews.title: Nice and easy
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific log holder solution because the size can be adjusted by using 2x4s the desired length of the space to be used. Easy peasy! And it looks nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Rock

customer_reviews.title: Easy and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was easy and it’s very sturdy. It’s great that it is adjustable in size when you build it to be able to accommodate your specific needs.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: These were easy to assemble and work as expected to hold wood. The flexibility of length is only limited by the length of 2x4 boards you choose and a flat solid surface. nice product.
customer_reviews.author: FJK

customer_reviews.title: Great firewood holder.
customer_reviews.text: I stored a lot of wood on it. It’s well built for what you pay. I happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M.

customer_reviews.title: Read the entire description (I didn't) - the 2 - ...
customer_reviews.text: Read the entire description (I didn't) - the 2 - 2x4s and needed screws are not included. Other than that, it is strong enough if you only need a 4 foot-wide wood rack. Anything wider might be a little flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Myra G

customer_reviews.title: Its easy
customer_reviews.text: By buying longer lengths of 2x4'S you can make it as long as needed
customer_reviews.author: Captain

product_meta.title: Landmann USA 82424 Adjustable Firewood Rack
product_meta.description: Landmann USA 82424 adjustable firewood rack, up to 16' Wide
feature_bullets: Length determined by 2 x 4 lumber that is used
Powder coat finish is durable and weather resistant
Measures 13-3/4 D by 41-1/2 H and up to 16 feet Wide.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars876 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
